results.title: Five Things You Need to Know About the Supreme Court Case That Could Radically Change Elections
results.abstract: The Supreme Court heard arguments today on a legal theory that holds that state courts cannot review their legislatures’ rules for federal elections, even when the rules violate the state constitution.

media.caption: Members of the League of Women Voters rally for voting rights outside the U.S. Supreme Court, which is hearing oral arguments on Wednesday in a case from North Carolina that could radically reshape how elections are conducted.

results.title: After 65 Years, the ‘Boy in the Box’ Has a Name
results.abstract: Detective work and DNA analysis helped officials learn the identity of a 4-year-old boy whose beaten body was found inside a cardboard box in Philadelphia in 1957. The killing remains unsolved.

media.caption: Capt. Jason Smith of the Philadelphia police, center, with William C. Fleisher of the Vidocq Society, a forensic investigative group, and the Philadelphia medical examiner, Dr. Constance DiAngelo, at a news conference on Thursday where the authorities identified a boy found dead in a cardboard box in 1957.
